name: Arizona
title: $1.3 billion in funding released by U.S. Department of Education
description: About two weeks since the U.S. Department of Education withheld over $6 billion in federal funding for schools nationwide – a little over $1 billion has been released for after-school programs. According to state superintendent Tom Horne, in the current fiscal year, Arizona receives around $24 million in after-school funds. And while this is a big deal – there’s still over $5 billion being withheld.
